attributes.action: Dismiss John Bercow as Speaker. He has destroyed his credibility as a neutral.
attributes.additional_details:
The Speaker is the chief officer and highest authority of the House of Commons and must remain politically impartial at all times.

http://www.parliament.uk/business/commons/the-speaker/the-role-of-the-speaker/role-of-the-speaker/

Bercow's speech: 
https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/feb/06/donald-trump-should-not-be-allowed-to-speak-in-westminster-hall-says-speaker

His speech has prompted condemnation across the political spectrum.
attributes.background: It's vital to our democracy that the Speaker of the House of Commons show political neutrality. Bercow demonstrated he's lost his when he sought unilaterally to bar a foreign leader from addressing the House based on his own personal political view. All sides agree he has over-reached and must go.

rejection.details:
There is no mechanism for the removal of a Speaker during a Parliament. Other than at a general election, the Speaker can only stop being Speaker through resignation or death.

If you like, you could sign the petition below, which asks the House of Commons to debate a vote of no confidence in the Speaker:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/183279
